p: Enchytraeus albidus worms were produced from a laboratory culture obtained in 2005 from the fish food company Tierfischfutter in Jena, Germany. The loamy sand used in all experiments was from a Danish pea field at Foulum near Viborg, and had the following composition: 35% coarse sand, 46% fine sand, 9.4% silt, 8.9% clay, and 1.7% organic matter with a pH of 6.8 [ 23].
